text:
*I went through the Backlink profiles of 15 SaaS brands in the sales niche & found the best performing linkbuilding tactics (see screenshot below)*

You can replicate these in your niche as well.

*Stats pages* - A compilation of stats about the industry resulted in an average of 124 Root domains to the sites who used this tactic.

Since X stats/ X statistic KWs dont have a lot of search volume, we can safely assume that the high number of links is not a result of a lot of people coming across these pages rather how easily citable they are.

If you are in the automation SaaS space lets say, you could create a page about Automation statistics by either compiling statistics from other sources or doing your own research

*Template Pages -* Such pages had an avg of 174 Root domains pointing to them.

People love templates. Creating something from scratch takes hard work and people dont always have the time or the will to do that.

lets say you are in the email marketing saas space, you can create templates around Christmas promotion, Thanksgiving promotion email etc

You can either house it as a library for different templates or publish multiple blog posts aimed at templates for different themes.

*Chrome extention with free functionality -* These kind of pages got an avg of 325 RDs.

If you are a SaaS of any kind, try to think about what all does your SaaS accomplish. Build a chrome extention around one of the features and provide limited functionality to that feature for free via the extention.

If you have a chrome extention that just works with the paid plan, its not going to help you much with your link acquisition efforts.

But even if you provide 50-100 credits every month for free to the extention users, people gonna talk about it. Bloggers love to talk about free resources!

Drop a :fire:if you liked the information!
